intro: Stigmaphyllon cordatum, commonly known as the heartleaf stigmaphyllon, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are typically glossy and have a velvety texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the warmer months. Stigmaphyllon cordatum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
